Posts.Content: Thanks for the heads up on the honey. I have ordered some too.   I have my results from my node clearance biopsy tomorrow and I'm expecting to find out when chemo will start.   I'm a little nervous but I will start on the manuka ASAP and try to bolster my immunity as much as possible before it starts.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in 11 days.....

Posts.Content: ..Hi Hannah,When I first noticed the changes in my Breast, I expected it to be a non cancerous cyst of some sort as there is a history of this in the family. My sister,  my mother and 2 maternal aunts all have had lumps removed.I mentioned to my mum that I wasn't concerned as there is no history of cancer,  when she dropped the bomb that her cousin had had cancer. She is still alive and kicking now,  decades later, but it was still a shock to hear.  Due to me being diagnosed at a young age, my 2 sisters have to undergo checks just in case. I am going against hope that I am the odd one out,  but I think I'd rather they were regularly checked and any changes were caught early, add they were with me. My lump,  when removed was only 12mm and had already got into the sentinel lymph node, so I'm pleased I saw the changes when I did and got straight into the doctors. I hope everything goes ok with you and wish you lots of luck xx Nicola
Posts.Title: Discovered a family history

Posts.Content: Hi Jacky,   you mentioned the NHS exemption card, can I just ask, is this something that needs to be applied for separately?  Forgive me if I've piggy backed on this discussion, I would be grateful if somebody could signpost me to the relevant topic, I only got my diagnosis on 17/07 so I'm feeling kind of swept away with all this cancer Lark!
Posts.Title: Cancer diagnosis = disability?

Posts.Content: Thanks very much for that, I will ring my bcn and ask her. I currently get tax credits exemption, but I accidentally threw away the new one and kept the old one I think! Dozy mare!
Posts.Title: Cancer diagnosis = disability?

Posts.Content: Oh no Joy, I'm sorry to hear that.  It may be one ofa number of other reasons that there has been blood in the stools, fingers crossed that this the case for you.  Don't feel bad for having a rant, it's completely understandable xxx
Posts.Title: Failed mammogram and bowel screening in the same month!

Posts.Content: Hi Mandy,  I don't think you're being irrational at all. It is understandable, having got used to a structure, to be apprehensive about it changing.  I was due to have my first chemo tomorrow and is been delayed due to a stupid cold, of all things! I want looking forward to the chemo but nor doi like this uncertainty. I also felt adrift in the time between my results appointment in the breast care unit after surgery, and my first oncology appointment was very difficult to bear.  It wasn't particularity longer than other waits,  but there was no definite timescale, and that left me feeling edgy.  Yes,  there will be times when you will be ecstatic that you have overcome this very aggressive treatment, but there will also be the down days, and don't feel bad for them. Sending lots of hugs for you,  and I'm glad you have your German Shepherd to take care of you in the wee hours too xxx Nicola
Posts.Title: 5th Chemo done 1 more to go , should be happy .....but

Posts.Content: Hi Lucy, one thing I wish I'd had in hindsight was dry shampoo.  I had long dark hair that required daily washing and as I was sent home with a drain and struggled to move my arm following my axillary node clearance,  my hair vent disgusting and itchy!  After around 5 days my mum took me to the hairdressers for a backwash. It's such a relief now to run a flannel over my head ina morning ;-)  wishing you lots of luck with your surgery, and make sure to get plenty of rest afterwards,  you'll have earned those naps  Nicola x
Posts.Title: Pre-op advice

Posts.Content: Hi Suze, mistymoley is right,  we are covered under what used to be disability discrimination act,  it's all under the umberella of the equality act now,  it would be worth asking if they can get a temp in while needed. It would be a shame to give it up if you may be ready at a  later date and it may help to have something to aim for?
Posts.Title: Hi ... and help please!!

Posts.Content: Hi Willow,  I am so sorry to hear you have had such a poor experience during what is already a scary And psetting time for you.  I know the NHS staff do a difficult job, but I do think you deserve to be treated with much more kindness than you received.  I hope you find the care better from now on.   Lots of gentle hugs from East Lancashire xxx  Nicola
Posts.Title: Not so great experiences with NHS - good news stories please!

Posts.Content: Best of luck today Wendy xxxx love from Nicola
Posts.Title: Mastectomy -1day to go

Posts.Content: Hi Jessie, it is all a confusing whirlwind, I agree.  I too, felt very swept away by it all.  In my case, the consultant was also pretty certain it was cancer even before the biopsy results. After I had the biopsies taken, it was 8 days until I got the results.  I received a letter just a few short days after the initial consultation with the appointment.  The probability of surgery and radiotherapy was mentioned immediately and I was given a date for surgery when I was given the biopsy results.  I had all of my appointments at the breast clinic up until my post op biopsy results came back all clear, at which pointi was told I wouldn't need to go back to the breast clinic for 12 months,  but that I would receive an appointment for oncology within 2 weeks.   That wait felt endless and I did feel a little abandoned, but now I'm back in the fast lane again.  Just take heart that is all moving so fast as they are removing that nasty cancer as Quickly as possible.  I think they don't want to overwhelm us with info as theres an infinite amount of possibilities and until you go back to the consultant for results, they don't know for certain which path you will take.  Just know that everybody here is there for you, everybody is at different stages and has a different tale to tell so the help is there whenever you need it.  Need a rant?we're here fit that too  xxx
Posts.Title: Confused, need help

Posts.Content: What wonderful news! I'm made up for you Nicola xxx
Posts.Title: lymph node biopsy clear
